data.title: Above and beyond!!
data.text: I collect hats from Hard Rock Cafes in cities I travel to.  In Louisville, I had a small window of time available to go to the store. Got there at 10am and store/restaurant opened at 11am. Disappointed, but a worker was setting up tables outside in advance of opening and asked if she could help. Explained my wish and voilá. Marsha, a manager who happened to be there setting up early, escorted us to the store and allowed me to get my hat. That's customer service!!

data.title: Good Cafe
data.text: This is a very nice place to visit even after a good basketball game at night. After the U of L game my sister & her husband and a friend of ours went there to eat. We all got the Club sandwich with 2 sides yum yum good.The staff was so nice, although it was late we arrive after nine because google said they closed at 11:00pm but as we entered the host said 10:00pm due to convention center renovation's, Any way it's on the door close at 11:00pm. But overall great service, food portion's and lovely decor. Our server Katie was so nice & friendly. Ally was so nice to play music requested Prince :) Mark came by and ask if everything was alright. I will be back.

data.title: Bachelorette weekend
data.text: Had reservations but were running behind. Called to advise and they said no problem that they would push them back. Get there and the place is half full. Knowing that there was our party coming and another large party coming within minutes of each other they had nothing set up. We had to wait to be seated when they could have had tables set up and ready to go as son as both parties arrived. The waitress blew hot and cold. Our waitress didn't know whether to ask for anything or not because one time one person would ask she would be fine and the next time someone would ask something she would respond with eye rolls and short answers. There's no use complaining to management. Every Hard Rock that I've visited has been this way. I keep holding out hope that I will find one that has food, service and atmosphere all on the same high level but I have yet to find one. 😕

data.title: Great food
data.text: We were here on a Friday night. Service was top notch and the food great. You have to try the iced tea. Freshly brewed and the best I've had in a while!

data.title: Scatterbrained Waiter
data.text: First of all we walked in expecting to be seated by a hostess..gift shop attendant said to wait she would get her. .waited for another 5 minutes and a lady finally appeared. She asked if we wanted to sit outside and due to the heat we said no which offended her, don't know why. The inside seating was not full. She took us to a table. A waiter came by and said he would be right back...yea much later! Finally ordered drinks and appetizer..waiter brought them and  practically slid them across the table at us and said he would be right back with plates...which he never did. After watching him running back and forth we finally just ate them off napkins. My husband and i ordered BBQ sandwiches which included beans and slaw. The sandwiches arrived without the sides. Once again waiter said they were coming.....later. Got the slaw first....beans came later .Beans were canned chili and were cold. Slaw was ok but would have been better if we could have eaten it and the chili with the rest of the meal. Our 1st impression of Hard Rock was not a good one....don't know if there will a 2nd visit!

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Loved going here. Food was delicious. Our waitress was great! The atmosphere was upbeat and if you love music and history of music of all kinds def go here. It is everywhere. We enjoyed looking as much as we did the food and staff.

data.title: Poor experience
data.text:
Although I am sure not all experiences here are poor. Mine this week was. Walked in with co workers and no one paid any attention to us. No one came to take a drink order, or welcome us. Nothing. After 15 mins of non acknowledgement we decided to visit some place else. This was in late afternoon, not a very busy time for the company. (2:30pm to be exact)
I do hope to try again another time and pray they have a better experience to offer.

data.title: No Love All Serve All Here!
data.text: Wanted to stop by for drinks, maybe dinner. Street concert going on outside, it was Saturday 7 pm. Still lots of open tables on the patio and none marked. When we asked for a table on the patio, we were told they were all reserved. Restaurant was empty inside but we could eat there. No thanks! We moved on to more friendly and honest places off Fourth Street!!

data.title: Great service!
data.text:
I think for the most part the food here is consistent from city to city. What really made the difference was the great, friendly service!
We stopped in to have a drink and appetizer and we were glad we did.

data.title: Simply terrible....
data.text:
What can I say about a visit to an iconic restaurant chain location that was simply the worst experience at a Hard Rock Cafe ever. I have visited locations in Toronto, New York, Orlando, Nashville etc. and all were great experiences. 

While attempting to be friendly, (actually they were friendly until we complained about the poor service), the staff was almost completely incompetent. We made drink requests for two drinks but staff seemed unaware of what they had available. I knew more about the product they offered than they did. Only received one of two drinks that were ordered and only received the 2nd drink after going to the bartender myself to get the drink after 20 minutes and it still took 10 minutes more. The place was 90% empty!

The food:  we can't really say if it is good or not since we didn't eat it. The burgers were not cooked. It took 45 minutes to get the food and it wasn't even cooked! (Burger)

The only positive was the Manager Mark who sincerely tried to help and profusely apologized for his staff and promised he would work to resolve the issues. He cleared the bill and gave a couple of souvenir glasses with his apology. He seemed to want to fix the issues and I am hopeful he can. The area of Louisville where the Hard Rock Cafe is located is very nicely setup in Fourth Street.

data.title: Hard Rock Cafe Louisville
data.text:
I was in town for a 3 day trade show, and I always come up town to eat at least one meal here. The menu at all Hard Rocks vary some what to the local, but the burgers are same at all the locations I've been at, and that is way I like it. It's been about 12 months since I ate at a Hard Rock, and the burger selection has changed. Gone was my favorite, the mushroom swiss burger. So I had the Hickory Barbecue Bacon Cheeseburger. I sub'd swiss cheese for the cheddar.  Food arrived hot, serving size was large, as the burger starts out as a 1/2 pound. Fries were cooked just right. My server was on top of things and I never had to ask for my Mt. Dew glass to be refilled.
On the night I visited, a Friday night, the place was busy, but being solo I got my seat in under 10 minuets. They had live entertainment that night, and while a small band, they were quite good. Played mostly their own songs. Sound level was appropriate for the size of the place. One could carry on a conversation without the need to yell to be heard. Plenty of paid street parking available. But as the night wears on you will have to walk a bit to arrive here. The street is blocked off to cars, so one can wander back and forth without worrying about being it. It's called 4th Street Live. Plenty to see and look at.

data.title: Yummy food and music
data.text:
We try to check out the HRC whenever we go to a new city and are rarely disappointed. This one is on Fourth Street downtown and very popular. If you are planning to go, use Open Table and make a reservation to beat the crowds.

Hubs opted for the ribs and I had the Mac and chicken pasta with broccoli. Both options were tasty and left us full.

Prices are reasonable and the store here was well stocked. That is unusual since most times there a few shirts available in as many size options as we found her.

data.title: Date Night Perfect!
data.text: Went to have dinner and check out 4th street. It is perfect. Shopping, live concerts in the street, and great food. I will definitely be going back, and would recommend this place to anyone!

data.title: Fun but very slow
data.text: Quick easy walk from our hotel and seated quickly.  Drinks brought and food order taken very promptly, then over 40 minutes we waited to eat.  The restaurant wasn't very busy for a Thursday evening to have such a long wait to be served.  Wait staff was exceptional and the food was on target for what we were expecting.   The wait time to eat is what lowers my rating.  I expect to be in and out in about an hour to 75 minutes in this type of restaurant.  2 hours was way too long.

data.title: Small, slow service
data.text: It's a Hard Rock so the food is a bit institutional.  Went around 10pm on a Saturday.  Waited for a table for nine which was expected but the wait for drinks and desserts seemed a bit long.  On the plus side was that they were willing and able to make a local mixed drink not on the menu and without our asking, split shared desserts between checks. A mixed drink and half dessert ran $13.79 before tip.

data.title: good people, good Management
data.text: they were packed, they got us a table in a timely fashion and the Server Marissa was fantastic. I ordered the chicken nachos and my girlfriend ordered the pulled pork. both were delicious. the manager came over to the table and apologized for the wait even though I had no problem with it they were very packed and I still felt that the server gave us more than appropriate service. the drinks were perfectly made.

data.title: So-so for a Hard Rock
data.text: While you don't expect a 'fine dining experience' at a Hard Rock Café, I think you should be able to expect good service and decent food.  This Hard Rock barely meets any minimums.  We had a late lunch here and it wasn't crowded at all.  There were 2 large groups, and us.  Yet service was very slow- especially after we placed our food orders.  The BBQ chicken was ok- tender and juicy, though a bit salty.  The fries, though were dry and tasted like they had been under a warming lamp a long while.

data.title: Staff was great!
data.text: I went for an after party event for a conference I was attending.  Very small and the tvs were too small over the bar to see the game.  The staff was great and very friendly.  I would love to go back and have a meal.

data.title: live music
data.text: I enjoyed a bloody mary and live music while at Hard Rock Cafe.  They had four different bands and the bartender was kind enough to put he Carolina Panthers game on for me.

data.title: Wasn't very happy
data.text: We got seated in a tight corner when several open space tables were open. Ordered wine at $8 a glass and only got it half filled. Waiter ditched us before we got our food and then had paper in my cheeseburger from the cheese. Manager made it right with me on food but never got all my wine.. the whole experience was very bizarre and we will not return.
